title: Two Russian planes flew within 500 feet of U.S. Navy ships

content: ...though I apprecaite the restaint of our military, IMHO - they should have been shot down. Maybe "if" they are Russian we know they won't do something too stupid - but what if they were Russian planes sold to the Iranians - NK - al Qaeda - etc - and suddenly opened it's bay doors (or whatever) and dropped a dirty bomb on the aircraft carrier. Heck, for that matter they could simply drop 5-10 barrels of nuclear waste or and that ship would be useless because of contamination... I might be wrong but that would be an easy way to eliminate our carriers... Just my 2-pence

title: Two Russian planes flew within 500 feet of U.S. Navy ships

content: ABC at least had it, and a day earlier than your source: "http://blogs.abcnews.com/politicalradar/2009/03/russian-planes.html" While provocative, it occurred in international waters so the Russians could fly where they pleased. This had been happening for decades (on both sides, I believe) but stopped from the fall of the USSR until recently. Russia is trying to once again be a world military power, and part of that is showing that you can project influence outside your own borders. So this is nothing new, it just has not happened in a while.
reply: ABC at least had it, and a day earlier than your source: "http://blogs.abcnews.com/politicalradar/2009/03/russian-planes.html" While provocative, it occurred in international waters so the Russians could fly where they pleased. title: Two Russian planes flew within 500 feet of U.S. Navy ships

content: Simmer down now…..nothing to see here! It’s been happening for decades and not just with the Russians! We had a French (they are notorious for flybys) Rafale fly between two ships that were about to do an UNREP, and I’ve also seen an Iranian a/c fly within 200 feet!
reply: Simmer down now…..nothing to see here! It’s been happening for decades and not just with the Russians! We had a French (they are notorious for flybys) Rafale fly between two ships that were about to do an UNREP, and I’ve also seen an Iranian a/c fly within 200 feet!

title: Two Russian planes flew within 500 feet of U.S. Navy ships

content: quote: Originally posted by Knele: Simmer down now…..nothing to see here! It’s been happening for decades and not just with the Russians! We had a French (they are notorious for flybys) Rafale fly between two ships that were about to do an UNREP, and I’ve also seen an Iranian a/c fly within 200 feet! I can second the French connection... At least once a year French flights would buzz our airfield in Mainz, Germany... at less than 200'AGL and through several permanent no-fly areas. All we could do is ask Frankfort Am Main to track them and file a complaint. Kept me busy filling out forms and depositions after each one... still get ****ed a little thinking about it... LOL
quote: Originally posted by Knele: Simmer down now…..nothing to see here! It’s been happening for decades and not just with the Russians! title: Two Russian planes flew within 500 feet of U.S. Navy ships

content: quote: Originally posted by GlassOnion: ...though I apprecaite the restaint of our military, IMHO - they should have been shot down. Maybe "if" they are Russian we know they won't do something too stupid - but what if they were Russian planes sold to the Iranians - NK - al Qaeda - etc - and suddenly opened it's bay doors (or whatever) and dropped a dirty bomb on the aircraft carrier. Heck, for that matter they could simply drop 5-10 barrels of nuclear waste or and that ship would be useless because of contamination... I might be wrong but that would be an easy way to eliminate our carriers... Just my 2-pence The USN usually has eyes on the offender long before the are within visual range of the ships of a CVBG. Radar can track where they are coming from. Decon procedures have been in place for decades. If an acft did drop something, the rest of its life will be short, but very exciting.

reply: The USN usually has eyes on the offender long before the are within visual range of the ships of a CVBG. Radar can track where they are coming from. Decon procedures have been in place for decades. If an acft did drop something, the rest of its life will be short, but very exciting.

In my mind, that just seems like a very good ploy to get close enough to do some damage - thinking it was only another Russian knucklehead play captain tough-guy when it just might be Mohammads Mojo working overtime trying to stir the pot again... but they'd still be good for target practice...

title: Two Russian planes flew within 500 feet of U.S. Navy ships

content: This happened all the time with the Russians in the past when tensions were much higher than they are now. So, same 'ol same 'ol. Shoot, when I was in the Gulf, we got flybys by Iranian F-14s and P-3s just about every other week. It was actually pretty cool. Almost everybody on the ship that wasn't on watch would come topside with their cameras and snap a few shots. So, that tells you how scared we were.
reply: This happened all the time with the Russians in the past when tensions were much higher than they are now. So, same 'ol same 'ol. Shoot, when I was in the Gulf, we got flybys by Iranian F-14s and P-3s just about every other week. It was actually pretty cool. Almost everybody on the ship that wasn't on watch would come topside with their cameras and snap a few shots. So, that tells you how scared we were.

content: back when i was in the navy, we were doing a team spirit, (team spirit was what this joint operation was called when i was in, don't know about now), with the rok navy and marines, there was always a mig flying over us, sometimes they were close enough for us to see the pilot wave at us! they have always been doing fly-by's. it's nothing new.

title: Two Russian planes flew within 500 feet of U.S. Navy ships

content: quote: Originally posted by sw614: quote: Originally posted by Knele: quote: Originally posted by MaddogK: Oops, sorry 'comrade'. That’s an anti-missile system, not anti aircraft; unless it’s a Cessna. CIWS can not track or shoot an air breathing target? Yes, it can kill air-craft or missiles out to 1 mile range. Like running into a wall. Just turn on, tag the target, and tell it "KILL". It can also kill a ship or boat with a camara sight unit.
quote: Originally posted by sw614: quote: Originally posted by Knele: quote: Originally posted by MaddogK: Oops, sorry 'comrade'. That’s an anti-missile system, not anti aircraft; unless it’s a Cessna. CIWS can not track or shoot an air breathing target?
reply: Yes, it can kill air-craft or missiles out to 1 mile range. Like running into a wall. Just turn on, tag the target, and tell it "KILL". It can also kill a ship or boat with a camara sight unit.
title: Two Russian planes flew within 500 feet of U.S. Navy ships

content: quote: Originally posted by sw614: quote: Originally posted by Knele: quote: Originally posted by MaddogK: Oops, sorry 'comrade'. That’s an anti-missile system, not anti aircraft; unless it’s a Cessna. CIWS can not track or shoot an air breathing target? Theoretically it could, but its range is only 1 mile (at this point it’s more of a shotgun)....no hostile A/C (equped with anti-ship missiles) is going to get that close, and if he does....kiss your ass goodbye.
